alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Childress; Cottle; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 04 at 2:22AM CDT until September 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY...AND DRY THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE FAR SOUTHEAST TX PANHANDLE AND NORTHERN ROLLING PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 9 PM CDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Timing...Today, from 1 PM CDT until 9 PM CDT. * Wind...Southwest winds around 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph. Brief, but erratic gusts up to 50 mph with any showers or thunderstorms. * Humidity...As low as 13 percent. * Fuels...Critically dry. * Impacts...Fires can spread rapidly in these conditions, especially with any showers or thunderstorms containing even stronger winds. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of gusty winds, low relative humidity, lightning, and hot temperatures will contribute to critical fire behavior.
